title: Orbit Fab gets $12 million to integrate refueling port with military satellites
summary: Orbit Fab, a venture-funded startup offering a refueling service in space, announced it has won a $12 million deal to ensure its fueling interface works with U.S. military satellites.

title: International talks on space norms to continue but U.S. will not engage directly with Russia
summary: Bilateral U.S.-Russia space talks that had begun before the invasion of Ukraine are off the table for now, a U.S. State Department official said March 17.

title: NASA moon rocket SLS ready for rollout to “rebuilt” LC-39B ahead of Artemis 1 rehearsal
summary: A moment more than a decade in the making. NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket for the Artemis 1 mission will make its first trip down the crawlerway at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Thursday evening, March 17.

title: Watch live: NASA’s new moon rocket rolls to launch pad tonight
summary: NASA will roll the Space Launch System, a heavy-duty rocket designed to send astronauts to the moon, out of the iconic Vehicle Assembly Building at the Kennedy Space Center on Thursday evening. A crawler-transporter originally built more than 50 years ago for the Apollo program will haul the towering rocket to its launch pad for a countdown dress rehearsal. The rollout is set to begin at 5 p.m. EDT (2100 GMT).

title: ESA suspends work with Russia on ExoMars mission
summary: ESA has formally halted plans to launch its ExoMars mission on a Russian rocket in September in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Sierra Space to work with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries on commercial space station technologies
summary: Sierra Space and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) have signed an agreement to study collaboration on technologies to support a planned commercial space station.

title: SpaceX tests fully stacked Starship rocket for the first time
summary: After rapidly stacking Ship 20 and Booster 4 the evening prior, SpaceX appears to have begun testing a fully stacked Starship rocket...

title: China launches second Yaogan-34 reconnaissance satellite
summary: A Long March 4C rocket sent a new classified Yaogan satellite into orbit Thursday, marking China’s sixth orbital launch of 2022.

title: Starship undergoing full-stack cryoproofing while Florida ramps up
summary: Preparations are underway for the next milestone for the Starship program, following the stacking of Ship 20 atop Booster 4. For the third time, the second using the Mechazilla chopstick system, Starbase has a full-stack at the Orbital Launch Site, this time setting up a cryoproofing test with both the Booster and Ship stacked together.

title: KSAT invests in dedicated lunar communications network
